Comparison charts for IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ processors (Series 1 and Series 2), IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ Ultra Processors (Series 1 and Series 2), IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ (14th gen through 5th gen),  and IntelÂ® Processor families for laptops are available below in Excel* spreadsheet and PDF formats. The Excel sheet has filtering features to select and compare any laptop processors.

If you need to find a feature for processors older than 5th Generation of IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢, refer to side-by-side specification comparisons for more information.

Laptop processors include letters in their numbers, such as HX, HK, H, U, P, G7, NG7, G4, G1, Y, HQ, M, or V. For more information, refer to understanding IntelÂ® Processor naming conventions.

You can identify the IntelÂ® Processor in your laptop and also find its generation.

Examples of how to use the Excel sheet filters

Example 1: Need a list to compare processors i7 for 12th and 13th generation.

You can use the filters multiple times, and undo your last selected filtering by clicking Ctrl+Z anytime.

Follow the steps below:

  • Step 1
    1. Use Brand Type filter and click the dropdown arrow in the box
    2. Uncheck Select All
    3. Check IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢
    4. Click OK
  • Step 2
    1. Use IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ Generation filter and click the dropdown arrow in the box
    2. Uncheck Select All
    3. Check 12th and 13th
    4. Click OK.
  • Step 3
    1. Use Brand Level filter and click the dropdown arrow in the box
    2. Uncheck Select All
    3. Check i7
    4. Click OK

A list of IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ 12th and 13th Generation with i7 is available to be compared.

Example 2: Need to find processors with maximum memory size of 64 GB.

Note that you can click Ctrl+Z any time to undo your last selected filters.

  • Step 1
    1. Use Max Memory Size filter and click the dropdown arrow in the box
    2. Uncheck Select All.
    3. Check 64 GB
    4. Click OK.

A list of IntelÂ® Coreâ„¢ processors supporting 64 GB is available to be compared.

If Excel is not available, use the PDF file instead

The PDF file allows you to compare if you do not have Excel installed. It provides the same information as the Excel file above but in a PDF format.
